text: At the age of only three months, my parents left me for my grandmother to babysit and never returned.
Regardless, I was growing up as a happy child until my grandmother passed away and I was left alone at the age of 14.
The loss of my last relative affected my mental strain for the next 8 years until my immigration to the US. It’s what had to be done.
Living without parents left me without financial support and I had to find a job that could cover the cost of my existence.
For a brief period of time, the quality of my life slowly started to improve as I finished High School and enrolled in courses for the marine stewardess.
With the stipend from the courses and waitressing I was able to cover the cost of the expensive seamen documents.
But my prosperity was short-lived as my mom with chronic alcoholism found me and tried to recall her parental rights and asked for the money from me.
After a long fight in the court, I was free from all charges and claims from her but that didn’t make my life easier.
When I turned 19 I passed the interview for the stewardess job on the ship. My excitement was enormous until the day I found out about my sickness.
I had to fight for my life with the course of medications for over two years. During this period of time, I landed a lot of money for treatment and had more troubles with my mother.
Fortunately, I was able to recover and get a job on the ship that helped me to pay my bills and make arrangements for my immigration to the US.
Without help at work and home, I became my own teacher. I learned how to fix some broken furniture, how to cook, and do other housework. I became as independent as I could to gain more strengths.

But at one point I realized that without proper knowledge and education I won’t go too far with my skills. I had to get an education that I was dreaming about in Ukraine but wasn’t able to achieve it.
Therefore, shortly after arrival in the US I enrolled in the college to presume my first real education at age of 27.

I am currently a full- time employee at medical office and a full- time student in the Computer Science major. During the weekends I spare my time learning new programming skills that could help me to land an internship or my first job.

Despite the lack of sleep I still have spare time to work on my immigration case and skills to play guitar. I also have a long list of volunteering at different shelters around the city because I love animals. My biggest dream is to work as a Software Developer
in company that creates various technologies for assisting animals in need.
The time will show how far I’ll be able to go with my plans but I am sincerely hoping that with the further constant work the reward of a happy life and fulfilled dreams will happen.

work.duties: Application scanning; working in active directory; responding and creating task tickets.
Managing front desk; data entry; responding to phone calls; medical billing; creating prior authorisations.
Restrainig animals; data entry; responding to emergancy calls; preparing surgery room; feeding and medicating animals.

reviews.name: Anna
reviews.review: I know her for a while... What a crazy person!
